content: Notes, added to Petrus Cantor, Biblical Commentaries
summary: The text is mainly a copy of Petrus Cantor's commentary on the Psalms in Latin. The Old English historical notes on fols 18r and 74v date the manuscript to 1193-94 (Ker 1957 p. 331).

notes.head: Addition
notes.body: (fol. 18r) Gysorz ƿæs ygolde filippe frankæne kinge þurh sƿicdome

notes.head: Note
notes.body: Refers to the capture of the Gisors in April 1193.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 74v) Filippe frankæne kyng ne spedde naht æt fernuyl

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 74v) tƿelfmonþe after þan þe he yƿan gisorz þurh sƿicdome

notes.head: Note
notes.body: Refers to the raising of the siege of Verneuil on 28th May 1194.

objectDesc.support: Parchment, with paper flyleaves. The fourth paper flyleaf at the front has the watermark
objectDesc.extent:
332 mm x 225 mm (dimensions of all - size of leaves).
252 mm x 154 mm (dimensions of all - size of writing grid).

binding: Red leather binding. On the cover is the Royal crest in gold. The spine reads 'P. CANTOR | BIBLICAL COMMENTARIES | BRITISH LIBRARY | ROYAL | MS. | 10 C. V'.
admin: Manuscript described by Hollie Morgan and Takako Kato with the assistance of Sanne van der Schee (2010; 2012).
